module Network.AWS.PinpointSMSVoice.Types.EventDestination

-- | An object that defines an event destination.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventDestination</a> smart constructor.
data EventDestination
EventDestination' :: Maybe [EventType] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe KinesisFirehoseDestination -> Maybe Text -> Maybe SnsDestination -> Maybe CloudWatchLogsDestination -> EventDestination
[$sel:matchingEventTypes:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> Maybe [EventType]

-- | Indicates whether or not the event destination is enabled. If the
--   event destination is enabled, then Amazon Pinpoint sends response data
--   to the specified event destination.
[$sel:enabled:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> Maybe Bool
[$sel:kinesisFirehoseDestination:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> Maybe KinesisFirehoseDestination

-- | A name that identifies the event destination configuration.
[$sel:name:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> Maybe Text
[$sel:snsDestination:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> Maybe SnsDestination
[$sel:cloudWatchLogsDestination:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> Maybe CloudWatchLogsDestination

-- | Create a value of <a>EventDestination</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointSMSVoice.Types.EventDestination.EventDestination
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointSMSVoice.Types.EventDestination.EventDestination
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointSMSVoice.Types.EventDestination.EventDestination
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.PinpointSMSVoice.Types.EventDestination.EventDestination
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointSMSVoice.Types.EventDestination.EventDestination
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointSMSVoice.Types.EventDestination.EventDestination


module Network.AWS.PinpointSMSVoice.Types.VoiceMessageContent

-- | An object that contains a voice message and information about the
--   recipient that you want to send it to.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVoiceMessageContent</a> smart constructor.
data VoiceMessageContent
VoiceMessageContent' :: Maybe CallInstructionsMessageType -> Maybe SSMLMessageType -> Maybe PlainTextMessageType -> VoiceMessageContent
[$sel:callInstructionsMessage:VoiceMessageContent'] :: VoiceMessageContent -> Maybe CallInstructionsMessageType
[$sel:sSMLMessage:VoiceMessageContent'] :: VoiceMessageContent -> Maybe SSMLMessageType
[$sel:plainTextMessage:VoiceMessageContent'] :: VoiceMessageContent -> Maybe PlainTextMessageType

-- | Create a value of <a>VoiceMessageContent</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:callInstructionsMessage:VoiceMessageContent'</a>,
--   <a>voiceMessageContent_callInstructionsMessage</a> - Undocumented
--   member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSMLMessage:VoiceMessageContent'</a>,
--   <a>voiceMessageContent_sSMLMessage</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:plainTextMessage:VoiceMessageContent'</a>,
--   <a>voiceMessageContent_plainTextMessage</a> - Undocumented member.
newVoiceMessageContent :: VoiceMessageContent

-- | Undocumented member.
voiceMessageContent_callInstructionsMessage :: Lens' VoiceMessageContent (Maybe CallInstructionsMessageType)

-- | Undocumented member.
voiceMessageContent_sSMLMessage :: Lens' VoiceMessageContent (Maybe SSMLMessageType)

-- | Undocumented member.
voiceMessageContent_plainTextMessage :: Lens' VoiceMessageContent (Maybe PlainTextMessageType)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointSMSVoice.Types.VoiceMessageContent.VoiceMessageContent
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointSMSVoice.Types.VoiceMessageContent.VoiceMessageContent
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointSMSVoice.Types.VoiceMessageContent.VoiceMessageContent
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointSMSVoice.Types.VoiceMessageContent.VoiceMessageContent
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointSMSVoice.Types.VoiceMessageContent.VoiceMessageContent
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointSMSVoice.Types.VoiceMessageContent.VoiceMessageContent
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.PinpointSMSVoice.Types.VoiceMessageContent.VoiceMessageContent


module Network.AWS.PinpointSMSVoice.Types

-- | API version <tt>2018-09-05</tt> of the Amazon Pinpoint SMS and Voice
--   Service SDK configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | The resource you attempted to access doesn't exist.
_NotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You've issued too many requests to the resource. Wait a few minutes,
--   and then try again.
_TooManyRequestsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The API encountered an unexpected error and couldn't complete the
--   request. You might be able to successfully issue the request again in
--   the future.
_InternalServiceErrorException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The input you provided is invalid.
_BadRequestException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The resource specified in your request already exists.
_AlreadyExistsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | There are too many instances of the specified resource type.
_LimitExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The types of events that are sent to the event destination.
newtype EventType
EventType' :: Text -> EventType
[fromEventType] :: EventType -> Text
pattern EventType_ANSWERED :: EventType
pattern EventType_BUSY :: EventType
pattern EventType_COMPLETED_CALL :: EventType
pattern EventType_FAILED :: EventType
pattern EventType_INITIATED_CALL :: EventType
pattern EventType_NO_ANSWER :: EventType
pattern EventType_RINGING :: EventType

-- | An object that defines a message that contains text formatted using
--   Amazon Pinpoint Voice Instructions markup.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCallInstructionsMessageType</a> smart constructor.
data CallInstructionsMessageType
CallInstructionsMessageType' :: Maybe Text -> CallInstructionsMessageType

-- | The language to use when delivering the message. For a complete list
--   of supported languages, see the Amazon Polly Developer Guide.
[$sel:text:CallInstructionsMessageType'] :: CallInstructionsMessageType -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CallInstructionsMessageType</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:text:CallInstructionsMessageType'</a>,
--   <a>callInstructionsMessageType_text</a> - The language to use when
--   delivering the message. For a complete list of supported languages,
--   see the Amazon Polly Developer Guide.
newCallInstructionsMessageType :: CallInstructionsMessageType

-- | The language to use when delivering the message. For a complete list
--   of supported languages, see the Amazon Polly Developer Guide.
callInstructionsMessageType_text :: Lens' CallInstructionsMessageType (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that contains information about an event destination that
--   sends data to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCloudWatchLogsDestination</a> smart constructor.
data CloudWatchLogsDestination
CloudWatchLogsDestination' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> CloudWatchLogsDestination

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Amazon Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role that is able to write event data to an Amazon
--   CloudWatch destination.
[$sel:iamRoleArn:CloudWatchLogsDestination'] :: CloudWatchLogsDestination -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the Amazon CloudWatch Log Group that you want to record
--   events in.
[$sel:logGroupArn:CloudWatchLogsDestination'] :: CloudWatchLogsDestination -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CloudWatchLogsDestination</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamRoleArn:CloudWatchLogsDestination'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchLogsDestination_iamRoleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of an Amazon Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that is
--   able to write event data to an Amazon CloudWatch destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logGroupArn:CloudWatchLogsDestination'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchLogsDestination_logGroupArn</a> - The name of the Amazon
--   CloudWatch Log Group that you want to record events in.
newCloudWatchLogsDestination :: CloudWatchLogsDestination

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Amazon Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role that is able to write event data to an Amazon
--   CloudWatch destination.
cloudWatchLogsDestination_iamRoleArn :: Lens' CloudWatchLogsDestination (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the Amazon CloudWatch Log Group that you want to record
--   events in.
cloudWatchLogsDestination_logGroupArn :: Lens' CloudWatchLogsDestination (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that defines an event destination.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventDestination</a> smart constructor.
data EventDestination
EventDestination' :: Maybe [EventType] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe KinesisFirehoseDestination -> Maybe Text -> Maybe SnsDestination -> Maybe CloudWatchLogsDestination -> EventDestination
[$sel:matchingEventTypes:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> Maybe [EventType]

-- | Indicates whether or not the event destination is enabled. If the
--   event destination is enabled, then Amazon Pinpoint sends response data
--   to the specified event destination.
[$sel:enabled:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> Maybe Bool
[$sel:kinesisFirehoseDestination:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> Maybe KinesisFirehoseDestination

-- | A name that identifies the event destination configuration.
[$sel:name:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> Maybe Text
[$sel:snsDestination:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> Maybe SnsDestination
[$sel:cloudWatchLogsDestination:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> Maybe CloudWatchLogsDestination

-- | Create a value of <a>EventDestination</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:matchingEventTypes:EventDestination'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestination_matchingEventTypes</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:EventDestination'</a>, <a>eventDestination_enabled</a>
--   - Indicates whether or not the event destination is enabled. If the
--   event destination is enabled, then Amazon Pinpoint sends response data
--   to the specified event destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kinesisFirehoseDestination:EventDestination'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestination_kinesisFirehoseDestination</a> - Undocumented
--   member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:EventDestination'</a>, <a>eventDestination_name</a> - A
--   name that identifies the event destination configuration.

--   <a>eventDestination_snsDestination</a> - Undocumented member.

--   member.
newEventDestination :: EventDestination

--   event destination is enabled, then Amazon Pinpoint sends response data
--   to the specified event destination.
eventDestination_enabled :: Lens' EventDestination (Maybe Bool)

-- | Undocumented member.
eventDestination_snsDestination :: Lens' EventDestination (Maybe SnsDestination)

-- | Undocumented member.
eventDestination_cloudWatchLogsDestination :: Lens' EventDestination (Maybe CloudWatchLogsDestination)

-- | An object that defines a single event destination.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventDestinationDefinition</a> smart constructor.

--   event destination is enabled, then Amazon Pinpoint sends response data

-- | An object that contains information about an event destination that
--   sends data to Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newKinesisFirehoseDestination</a> smart constructor.
data KinesisFirehoseDestination
KinesisFirehoseDestination' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> KinesisFirehoseDestination

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose
--   destination that you want to use in the event destination.
[$sel:iamRoleArn:KinesisFirehoseDestination'] :: KinesisFirehoseDestination -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that can write data to
--   an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose stream.
[$sel:deliveryStreamArn:KinesisFirehoseDestination'] :: KinesisFirehoseDestination -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>KinesisFirehoseDestination</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   Name (ARN) of the Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose destination that you
--   want to use in the event destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryStreamArn:KinesisFirehoseDestination'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisFirehoseDestination_deliveryStreamArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that can write data to an Amazon
--   Kinesis Data Firehose stream.
newKinesisFirehoseDestination :: KinesisFirehoseDestination

--   destination that you want to use in the event destination.

--   an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose stream.
kinesisFirehoseDestination_deliveryStreamArn :: Lens' KinesisFirehoseDestination (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that defines a message that contains unformatted text.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPlainTextMessageType</a> smart constructor.
data PlainTextMessageType
PlainTextMessageType' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> PlainTextMessageType

-- | The language to use when delivering the message. For a complete list
--   of supported languages, see the Amazon Polly Developer Guide.
[$sel:languageCode:PlainTextMessageType'] :: PlainTextMessageType -> Maybe Text

-- | The plain (not SSML-formatted) text to deliver to the recipient.
[$sel:text:PlainTextMessageType'] :: PlainTextMessageType -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the voice that you want to use to deliver the message. For
--   a complete list of supported voices, see the Amazon Polly Developer
--   Guide.
[$sel:voiceId:PlainTextMessageType'] :: PlainTextMessageType -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PlainTextMessageType</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:PlainTextMessageType'</a>,
--   <a>plainTextMessageType_languageCode</a> - The language to use when
--   delivering the message. For a complete list of supported languages,
--   see the Amazon Polly Developer Guide.
--   
--   <a>$sel:text:PlainTextMessageType'</a>,
--   <a>plainTextMessageType_text</a> - The plain (not SSML-formatted) text
--   to deliver to the recipient.
--   
--   <a>$sel:voiceId:PlainTextMessageType'</a>,
--   <a>plainTextMessageType_voiceId</a> - The name of the voice that you
--   want to use to deliver the message. For a complete list of supported
--   voices, see the Amazon Polly Developer Guide.
newPlainTextMessageType :: PlainTextMessageType

-- | The language to use when delivering the message. For a complete list
--   of supported languages, see the Amazon Polly Developer Guide.
plainTextMessageType_languageCode :: Lens' PlainTextMessageType (Maybe Text)

-- | The plain (not SSML-formatted) text to deliver to the recipient.
plainTextMessageType_text :: Lens' PlainTextMessageType (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the voice that you want to use to deliver the message. For
--   a complete list of supported voices, see the Amazon Polly Developer
--   Guide.
plainTextMessageType_voiceId :: Lens' PlainTextMessageType (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that defines a message that contains SSML-formatted text.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSSMLMessageType</a> smart constructor.
data SSMLMessageType
SSMLMessageType' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> SSMLMessageType

-- | The language to use when delivering the message. For a complete list
--   of supported languages, see the Amazon Polly Developer Guide.
[$sel:languageCode:SSMLMessageType'] :: SSMLMessageType -> Maybe Text

-- | The SSML-formatted text to deliver to the recipient.
[$sel:text:SSMLMessageType'] :: SSMLMessageType -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the voice that you want to use to deliver the message. For
--   a complete list of supported voices, see the Amazon Polly Developer
--   Guide.
[$sel:voiceId:SSMLMessageType'] :: SSMLMessageType -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SSMLMessageType</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:SSMLMessageType'</a>,
--   <a>sSMLMessageType_languageCode</a> - The language to use when
--   delivering the message. For a complete list of supported languages,
--   see the Amazon Polly Developer Guide.
--   
--   <a>$sel:text:SSMLMessageType'</a>, <a>sSMLMessageType_text</a> - The
--   SSML-formatted text to deliver to the recipient.
--   
--   <a>$sel:voiceId:SSMLMessageType'</a>, <a>sSMLMessageType_voiceId</a> -
--   The name of the voice that you want to use to deliver the message. For
--   a complete list of supported voices, see the Amazon Polly Developer
--   Guide.
newSSMLMessageType :: SSMLMessageType

-- | The language to use when delivering the message. For a complete list
--   of supported languages, see the Amazon Polly Developer Guide.
sSMLMessageType_languageCode :: Lens' SSMLMessageType (Maybe Text)

-- | The SSML-formatted text to deliver to the recipient.
sSMLMessageType_text :: Lens' SSMLMessageType (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the voice that you want to use to deliver the message. For
--   a complete list of supported voices, see the Amazon Polly Developer
--   Guide.
sSMLMessageType_voiceId :: Lens' SSMLMessageType (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that contains information about an event destination that
--   sends data to Amazon SNS.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSnsDestination</a> smart constructor.
data SnsDestination
SnsDestination' :: Maybe Text -> SnsDestination

--   to publish events to.
snsDestination_topicArn :: Lens' SnsDestination (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that contains a voice message and information about the
--   recipient that you want to send it to.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVoiceMessageContent</a> smart constructor.
data VoiceMessageContent
VoiceMessageContent' :: Maybe CallInstructionsMessageType -> Maybe SSMLMessageType -> Maybe PlainTextMessageType -> VoiceMessageContent
[$sel:callInstructionsMessage:VoiceMessageContent'] :: VoiceMessageContent -> Maybe CallInstructionsMessageType
[$sel:sSMLMessage:VoiceMessageContent'] :: VoiceMessageContent -> Maybe SSMLMessageType
[$sel:plainTextMessage:VoiceMessageContent'] :: VoiceMessageContent -> Maybe PlainTextMessageType

--   omitted.

-- | Undocumented member.

-- | Create a new voice message and send it to a recipient's phone number.
module Network.AWS.PinpointSMSVoice.SendVoiceMessage

-- | SendVoiceMessageRequest
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSendVoiceMessage</a> smart constructor.
data SendVoiceMessage
SendVoiceMessage' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe VoiceMessageContent -> Maybe Text -> SendVoiceMessage

-- | The name of the configuration set that you want to use to send the
--   message.
[$sel:configurationSetName:SendVoiceMessage'] :: SendVoiceMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The phone number that appears on recipients' devices when they receive
--   the message.
[$sel:callerId:SendVoiceMessage'] :: SendVoiceMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | The phone number that Amazon Pinpoint should use to send the voice
--   message. This isn't necessarily the phone number that appears on
--   recipients' devices when they receive the message, because you can
--   specify a CallerId parameter in the request.
[$sel:originationPhoneNumber:SendVoiceMessage'] :: SendVoiceMessage -> Maybe Text
[$sel:content:SendVoiceMessage'] :: SendVoiceMessage -> Maybe VoiceMessageContent

-- | The phone number that you want to send the voice message to.
[$sel:destinationPhoneNumber:SendVoiceMessage'] :: SendVoiceMessage -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SendVoiceMessage</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationSetName:SendVoiceMessage'</a>,
--   <a>sendVoiceMessage_configurationSetName</a> - The name of the
--   configuration set that you want to use to send the message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:callerId:SendVoiceMessage'</a>,
--   <a>sendVoiceMessage_callerId</a> - The phone number that appears on
--   recipients' devices when they receive the message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:originationPhoneNumber:SendVoiceMessage'</a>,
--   <a>sendVoiceMessage_originationPhoneNumber</a> - The phone number that
--   Amazon Pinpoint should use to send the voice message. This isn't
--   necessarily the phone number that appears on recipients' devices when
--   they receive the message, because you can specify a CallerId parameter
--   in the request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:content:SendVoiceMessage'</a>, <a>sendVoiceMessage_content</a>
--   - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinationPhoneNumber:SendVoiceMessage'</a>,
--   <a>sendVoiceMessage_destinationPhoneNumber</a> - The phone number that
--   you want to send the voice message to.
newSendVoiceMessage :: SendVoiceMessage

-- | The name of the configuration set that you want to use to send the
--   message.
sendVoiceMessage_configurationSetName :: Lens' SendVoiceMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The phone number that appears on recipients' devices when they receive
--   the message.
sendVoiceMessage_callerId :: Lens' SendVoiceMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The phone number that Amazon Pinpoint should use to send the voice
--   message. This isn't necessarily the phone number that appears on
--   recipients' devices when they receive the message, because you can
--   specify a CallerId parameter in the request.
sendVoiceMessage_originationPhoneNumber :: Lens' SendVoiceMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
sendVoiceMessage_content :: Lens' SendVoiceMessage (Maybe VoiceMessageContent)

-- | The phone number that you want to send the voice message to.
sendVoiceMessage_destinationPhoneNumber :: Lens' SendVoiceMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that that contains the Message ID of a Voice message that
--   was sent successfully.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSendVoiceMessageResponse</a> smart constructor.
data SendVoiceMessageResponse
SendVoiceMessageResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> SendVoiceMessageResponse

-- | A unique identifier for the voice message.
[$sel:messageId:SendVoiceMessageResponse'] :: SendVoiceMessageResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:SendVoiceMessageResponse'] :: SendVoiceMessageResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>SendVoiceMessageResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:messageId:SendVoiceMessageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sendVoiceMessageResponse_messageId</a> - A unique identifier for
--   the voice message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:SendVoiceMessageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>sendVoiceMessageResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.

--   set, you can add one or more event destinations to it.

-- | Update an event destination in a configuration set. An event
--   destination is a location that you publish information about your
--   voice calls to. For example, you can log an event to an Amazon
--   CloudWatch destination when a call fails.
module Network.AWS.PinpointSMSVoice.UpdateConfigurationSetEventDestination

-- | UpdateConfigurationSetEventDestinationRequest
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateConfigurationSetEventDestination</a> smart
--   constructor.
data UpdateConfigurationSetEventDestination
UpdateConfigurationSetEventDestination' :: Maybe EventDestinationDefinition -> Text -> Text -> UpdateConfigurationSetEventDestination
[$sel:eventDestination:UpdateConfigurationSetEventDestination'] :: UpdateConfigurationSetEventDestination -> Maybe EventDestinationDefinition

-- | EventDestinationName
[$sel:eventDestinationName:UpdateConfigurationSetEventDestination'] :: UpdateConfigurationSetEventDestination -> Text

-- | ConfigurationSetName
[$sel:configurationSetName:UpdateConfigurationSetEventDestination'] :: UpdateConfigurationSetEventDestination -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateConfigurationSetEventDestination</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventDestination:UpdateConfigurationSetEventDestination'</a>,
--   <a>updateConfigurationSetEventDestination_eventDestination</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventDestinationName:UpdateConfigurationSetEventDestination'</a>,
--   <a>updateConfigurationSetEventDestination_eventDestinationName</a> -
--   EventDestinationName
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationSetName:UpdateConfigurationSetEventDestination'</a>,
--   <a>updateConfigurationSetEventDestination_configurationSetName</a> -
--   ConfigurationSetName
newUpdateConfigurationSetEventDestination :: Text -> Text -> UpdateConfigurationSetEventDestination

-- | Undocumented member.
updateConfigurationSetEventDestination_eventDestination :: Lens' UpdateConfigurationSetEventDestination (Maybe EventDestinationDefinition)

-- | EventDestinationName
updateConfigurationSetEventDestination_eventDestinationName :: Lens' UpdateConfigurationSetEventDestination Text

-- | ConfigurationSetName
updateConfigurationSetEventDestination_configurationSetName :: Lens' UpdateConfigurationSetEventDestination Text

-- | An empty object that indicates that the event destination was updated
--   successfully.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateConfigurationSetEventDestinationResponse</a>
--   smart constructor.
data UpdateConfigurationSetEventDestinationResponse
UpdateConfigurationSetEventDestinationResponse' :: Int -> UpdateConfigurationSetEventDestinationResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:UpdateConfigurationSetEventDestinationResponse'] :: UpdateConfigurationSetEventDestinationResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of
--   <a>UpdateConfigurationSetEventDestinationResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:UpdateConfigurationSetEventDestinationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateConfigurationSetEventDestinationResponse_httpStatus</a> - The
--   response's http status code.
newUpdateConfigurationSetEventDestinationResponse :: Int -> UpdateConfigurationSetEventDestinationResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
updateConfigurationSetEventDestinationResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateConfigurationSetEventDestinationResponse Int

--   message.

-- | The phone number that appears on recipients' devices when they receive
--   the message.
sendVoiceMessage_callerId :: Lens' SendVoiceMessage (Maybe Text)

-- | The phone number that Amazon Pinpoint should use to send the voice
--   message. This isn't necessarily the phone number that appears on
--   recipients' devices when they receive the message, because you can
--   specify a CallerId parameter in the request.
sendVoiceMessage_originationPhoneNumber :: Lens' SendVoiceMessage (Maybe Text)

--   CloudWatch destination.
cloudWatchLogsDestination_iamRoleArn :: Lens' CloudWatchLogsDestination (Maybe Text)

--   events in.

--   event destination is enabled, then Amazon Pinpoint sends response data
--   to the specified event destination.
eventDestination_enabled :: Lens' EventDestination (Maybe Bool)

kinesisFirehoseDestination_deliveryStreamArn :: Lens' KinesisFirehoseDestination (Maybe Text)

--   of supported languages, see the Amazon Polly Developer Guide.
plainTextMessageType_languageCode :: Lens' PlainTextMessageType (Maybe Text)

plainTextMessageType_text :: Lens' PlainTextMessageType (Maybe Text)

--   a complete list of supported voices, see the Amazon Polly Developer
--   Guide.
plainTextMessageType_voiceId :: Lens' PlainTextMessageType (Maybe Text)

--   of supported languages, see the Amazon Polly Developer Guide.

--   Guide.

module Network.AWS.PinpointSMSVoice.Waiters


-- | Derived from API version <tt>2018-09-05</tt> of the AWS service
--   descriptions, licensed under Apache 2.0.
--   
--   Pinpoint SMS and Voice Messaging public facing APIs
module Network.AWS.PinpointSMSVoice

-- | API version <tt>2018-09-05</tt> of the Amazon Pinpoint SMS and Voice
--   Service SDK configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | The resource you attempted to access doesn't exist.
_NotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You've issued too many requests to the resource. Wait a few minutes,
--   and then try again.
_TooManyRequestsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The API encountered an unexpected error and couldn't complete the
--   request. You might be able to successfully issue the request again in
--   the future.
_InternalServiceErrorException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The input you provided is invalid.
_BadRequestException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The resource specified in your request already exists.
_AlreadyExistsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | There are too many instances of the specified resource type.
_LimitExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The types of events that are sent to the event destination.
newtype EventType
EventType' :: Text -> EventType
[fromEventType] :: EventType -> Text
pattern EventType_ANSWERED :: EventType
pattern EventType_BUSY :: EventType
pattern EventType_COMPLETED_CALL :: EventType
pattern EventType_FAILED :: EventType
pattern EventType_INITIATED_CALL :: EventType
pattern EventType_NO_ANSWER :: EventType
pattern EventType_RINGING :: EventType

-- | An object that defines a message that contains text formatted using
--   Amazon Pinpoint Voice Instructions markup.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCallInstructionsMessageType</a> smart constructor.
data CallInstructionsMessageType
CallInstructionsMessageType' :: Maybe Text -> CallInstructionsMessageType

-- | Create a value of <a>CallInstructionsMessageType</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:text:CallInstructionsMessageType'</a>,
--   <a>callInstructionsMessageType_text</a> - The language to use when
--   delivering the message. For a complete list of supported languages,
--   see the Amazon Polly Developer Guide.
newCallInstructionsMessageType :: CallInstructionsMessageType

--   fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   (ARN) of an Amazon Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that is
--   able to write event data to an Amazon CloudWatch destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logGroupArn:CloudWatchLogsDestination'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchLogsDestination_logGroupArn</a> - The name of the Amazon
--   CloudWatch Log Group that you want to record events in.
newCloudWatchLogsDestination :: CloudWatchLogsDestination

-- | An object that defines an event destination.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventDestination</a> smart constructor.
data EventDestination
EventDestination' :: Maybe [EventType] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe KinesisFirehoseDestination -> Maybe Text -> Maybe SnsDestination -> Maybe CloudWatchLogsDestination -> EventDestination

-- | Create a value of <a>EventDestination</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:matchingEventTypes:EventDestination'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestination_matchingEventTypes</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:EventDestination'</a>, <a>eventDestination_enabled</a>
--   - Indicates whether or not the event destination is enabled. If the
--   event destination is enabled, then Amazon Pinpoint sends response data
--   to the specified event destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kinesisFirehoseDestination:EventDestination'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestination_kinesisFirehoseDestination</a> - Undocumented
--   member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:EventDestination'</a>, <a>eventDestination_name</a> - A
--   name that identifies the event destination configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snsDestination:EventDestination'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestination_snsDestination</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchLogsDestination:EventDestination'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestination_cloudWatchLogsDestination</a> - Undocumented
--   member.
newEventDestination :: EventDestination

-- | An object that defines a single event destination.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventDestinationDefinition</a> smart constructor.
data EventDestinationDefinition
EventDestinationDefinition' :: Maybe [EventType] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe KinesisFirehoseDestination -> Maybe SnsDestination -> Maybe CloudWatchLogsDestination -> EventDestinationDefinition

-- | Create a value of <a>EventDestinationDefinition</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.

--   fields.
--

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   member.

--   <a>$sel:enabled:EventDestinationDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestinationDefinition_enabled</a> - Indicates whether or not
--   the event destination is enabled. If the event destination is enabled,
--   then Amazon Pinpoint sends response data to the specified event
--   destination.

--   <a>eventDestinationDefinition_kinesisFirehoseDestination</a> -
--   Undocumented member.

--   Undocumented member.
newEventDestinationDefinition :: EventDestinationDefinition

-- | An object that contains information about an event destination that
--   sends data to Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newKinesisFirehoseDestination</a> smart constructor.
data KinesisFirehoseDestination
KinesisFirehoseDestination' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> KinesisFirehoseDestination

-- | Create a value of <a>KinesisFirehoseDestination</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamRoleArn:KinesisFirehoseDestination'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisFirehoseDestination_iamRoleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose destination that you
--   want to use in the event destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryStreamArn:KinesisFirehoseDestination'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisFirehoseDestination_deliveryStreamArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that can write data to an Amazon
--   Kinesis Data Firehose stream.
newKinesisFirehoseDestination :: KinesisFirehoseDestination

-- | An object that defines a message that contains unformatted text.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPlainTextMessageType</a> smart constructor.
data PlainTextMessageType
PlainTextMessageType' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> PlainTextMessageType

-- | Create a value of <a>PlainTextMessageType</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:PlainTextMessageType'</a>,
--   <a>plainTextMessageType_languageCode</a> - The language to use when
--   delivering the message. For a complete list of supported languages,
--   see the Amazon Polly Developer Guide.
--   
--   <a>$sel:text:PlainTextMessageType'</a>,
--   <a>plainTextMessageType_text</a> - The plain (not SSML-formatted) text
--   to deliver to the recipient.
--   
--   <a>$sel:voiceId:PlainTextMessageType'</a>,
--   <a>plainTextMessageType_voiceId</a> - The name of the voice that you
--   want to use to deliver the message. For a complete list of supported
--   voices, see the Amazon Polly Developer Guide.
newPlainTextMessageType :: PlainTextMessageType

-- | An object that defines a message that contains SSML-formatted text.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSSMLMessageType</a> smart constructor.
data SSMLMessageType

-- | Create a value of <a>SSMLMessageType</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:languageCode:SSMLMessageType'</a>,
--   <a>sSMLMessageType_languageCode</a> - The language to use when
--   delivering the message. For a complete list of supported languages,
--   see the Amazon Polly Developer Guide.
--   
--   <a>$sel:text:SSMLMessageType'</a>, <a>sSMLMessageType_text</a> - The
--   SSML-formatted text to deliver to the recipient.
--   
--   <a>$sel:voiceId:SSMLMessageType'</a>, <a>sSMLMessageType_voiceId</a> -
--   The name of the voice that you want to use to deliver the message. For
--   a complete list of supported voices, see the Amazon Polly Developer
--   Guide.
newSSMLMessageType :: SSMLMessageType

-- | An object that contains information about an event destination that
--   sends data to Amazon SNS.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSnsDestination</a> smart constructor.

--   omitted.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic that you want
--   to publish events to.
newSnsDestination :: SnsDestination

-- | An object that contains a voice message and information about the
--   recipient that you want to send it to.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVoiceMessageContent</a> smart constructor.

--   omitted.
